page.title: 08CROFTING IN BACK
page.content: { WHAT IS A CROFT? Crofts are long ,narrow strips of land usually arranged side by side.There are long lists of rules and regulations governing them. {CROFTERS } A crofter is the person who works the croft ie: by keeping sheep,growing turnips,potatoes etc. {FINANCING A crofter nowadays can receive financial help from the Integrated Development Programme, Dept. of Agriculture and Fisheries, and the Highlands and Islands Development Board.Unfortunately these grants are rarely put to their full use. {LIVESTOCK Nearly every crofter has some sheep.They are mostly small,blackfaced sheep.For part of the year they are out on the{COMMON GRAZING.}
